Job Title: Sr Director, Construction and Facilities

Location: Los Angeles, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
The Senior Director of Construction and Facilities is a key leadership role responsible for creating and overseeing the standards, programs, and initiatives centered on building and maintaining our restaurants portfolio. The position will establish construction best practices, processes, resource planning and management for scale. It will work closely with design, development, and asset management to simplify construction and increase asset resilience and up time. This individual will lead a team of facilities managers to uphold our brand standards and ensure compliance with regulations. This role will work with Operations to develop a strong working partnership and interact with other support center departments to provide subject matter expertise and represent the needs of our operators and guests.

Responsibilities

The position is responsible for delivering the build-out of the pipeline for our profitable restaurant expansion. Performance is defined as exceeding the store week's plan, improving the unit economics by driving down Capex and increasing ROIC, and improving the processes and tools that help us reduce build-out time and accelerate our growth. This position will also co-author the capital plan for the existing fleet by working closely with the asset management team and operations to develop the capital reinvestment plan that best supports our teams, our customers, and our assets.

Manages maintenance and repair for all building systems including mechanical, electrical, plumbing, HVAC, general maintenance, and sustainability. Ensure all facilities work follows our company standards, conforms to specifications, and that work orders are tracked and managed within the budgeted guidelines.

Oversee the new store turnover process for scale, ensuring the team has a deep understanding of asset management and the ability to address unique issues that may impact facilities' upkeep on an ongoing basisBuild a resource allocation model, internally and externally, that unlocks rapid acceleration in new restaurant growth to protect and increase store weeks to planDevelop a Capital plan for New Restaurant Openings + Reinvestment, delivering a high ROIC and strategically reducing overall buildout cost for our growth pipelineLead the Construction center of excellence to build scalable tools for expanding our general contractor and vendor network, contracting and onboarding new partners, bidding and estimating projects, and sequencing construction schedules to accelerate pipeline countDevelop budget and strategies that optimize our repair and maintenance service to our restaurants, cost-effectively and efficiently, ensuring a positive guest experienceManage preventative maintenance schedules for all restaurants, equipment, and systemsEnsure compliance with safety standards and regulations for all restaurant facilitiesDrive continuous improvements for the organization by holding vendors accountable to established KPIs and actively consulting and training Operations teams on Facilities knowledge and ownershipPrepare capital allocation strategies to manage budgets associated with equipment replacement and remodels in partnership with Finance and Operations to Oversee Programmatic Equipment replacement projects executed by the Facilities ManagersManage, coach, and develop team of construction + facilities resources, and plan resource allocation for all projects and initiativesProvide active insights and input into functional design of facilities and choice of equipment to the design and construction team and influence decisions that are favorable for the long term upkeep of assets

You Are

An exceptional executive in the space of Facilities Management with strategic and functional skillsWell versed in Service Channel and its technology platforms to maximize its impact on R&M spend and trend analysisA strong leader, cross-functional collaborator, and proven expert in execution/implementationAble to travel 40-50% of the time

Qualifications

10+ years of prior experience in development in a construction and/or facilities leadership capacity in multi-unit environment; with emphasis on management in a restaurant environmentA bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent in education and experience. Certification in Restaurant Facilities Management Association, Facilities Management through International Facilities Management Association, or other organization preferredFinancial acumen and understanding of budgets, project planning, and estimatingStrong technical knowledge of all aspects of restaurant facilities maintenance, including HVAC, refrigeration, food prep and production equipment, electrical, plumbing and building systems and finishesStrong communication + management skills, both for executive-level reviews and for instruction + education with operations, via head coaches and restaurant teams. Knowledgeable in governing codes, safety (OSHA) rules, sanitation (NSF), and building codes (BOCA)Excellent consulting skills and ability to influence senior stakeholders to get things accomplished within a matrixed organization

What You'll Get

Highly competitive pay + bonus planThree different medical plans to suit your and your family's needsDental and Vision insuranceFlexible PTO plan401k programEmployee HSA and FSAComplimentary greensAn opportunity to make a real impact on the people around you, both by growing them and by connecting them to real foodTo live the sweetlife and celebrate your passion + purposeA collaborative team of people who live our core values and have your backA clear career path with opportunities for development, both personally and professionallyFree sweetgreen swag

Come join the sweetlife!

About Sweetgreen

sweetgreen is on a mission to build healthier communities by connecting people to real food. We passionately believe that real food should be convenient and accessible to everyone. Every day in each sweetgreen, our 3,500 team members make food from scratch, using fresh ingredients and produce delivered that morning. And in our local communities, we’re committed to leaving people better than we found them. We’re in the business of feeding people, and we’re out to change what that means.
